reviews.review_msg: He is rude and does not care. I would take a different course if possible.

His exam questions were horrible. The class average for a fourth-year class is a C+ without curving or scaling. Nearly half of the class failed the first exam and the final (50%). Ralph is very intimidating when he makes students answer their questions. The level of difficulty on the exam went beyond what was being taught in the lecture. ToughClass

Ralph outside of teaching seems to be a nice guy but in the context of class his unusual teaching style of never answering questions makes him intimidating and makes learning difficult. This class is VERY TA dependent as they do most of the marking, lab prep and exam prep. He goes too in-depth about irrelevant information and loves to yap.

He is not a good professor and I say this as a student with many many years of courses under my belt. He is extremely rude, does not care about his students and assumes everyone is plagiarizing. I am not exaggerating. He is unkind and accusatory and if given the opportunity he will try to make you feel bad about yourself or put you down.

I can't seem to find my review from fall2022 so I'll post again. DO'NT TAKE 442 WITH RALPH. I know that class fills up but that number drops QUICK and we only had 17 students. I wish I would've taken HSCI 440 or 441 but did not have pre req. Prof is absolutely useless, poor TA teaches the entire class. We only saw prof during midterm and final.

Very awkward phrasing, very broad talking, non informative, I had to spend extra time after class to figure out what he's talking about. Poor communication skills and does not handle questions very well. When you ask something he never maintains eye contact, not sure why it's so difficult for him to communicate. Such a weird experience.

Worst experience ever.. I had to take this lab course. No choice. Don't expect any guidance, clear directions from Prof or TA at all. Only advice- if you don't need it don't take this course at all. You will be left to figure out the purpose of each experiment on your own or your lab members. If you want a C take it!
